Description: On May 27, 2010, Gulf Chemical was charged in a state indictment with 11 counts of unpermitted discharges to the waters of the state in volation of the Texas Water Code. The corporation pled guilty to all counts and was sentenced to a $2.75 million criminal penalty and is required to make modifications to its wastewater treatment plant, that will bring it into compliance with its permit.

NAICS Translation: 331423: Secondary Smelting, Refining, and Alloying of Copper

Gulf Chemical's Freeport Facility to Pay $7.5 Million for ViolatingTexas Environmental Laws, Targeted News Service, August 14, 2013 (via Nexis).

Description: Gulf Chemical & Metallurgical Corp. entered into a plea agreement to pay $2.75 million and plead guilty to felony violations of the Texas Water Code by discharging waste catalysts with wastewater.

Notes: Modification of earlier Order, with additional penalty for delay in achieving compliance.
Penalty listed includes a $13,200 Supplemental Environmental Project.
